[SYNTAX]: Severe sentence fragmentation (e.g., "consigning gods their generation parents...")
[LEXICON]: Awkward phrasing (e.g., "the often were still by fields...")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between historical concepts (e.g., Industrial Revolution to 18th-century village description)
[CLARITY]: Unclear or incomplete sentences (e.g., "One result has of the not war...")

[SYNTAX]: Complex sentence structures (e.g., "We however who have witnessed...") slightly disrupt flow.
[LEXICON]: Occasional archaic or formal vocabulary (e.g., "lurid pictures," "vulgar language") may cause minor pauses.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from discussing poverty to "the astonishing progress" without clear linking.
[STRUCTURE]: Ideas (war impact, working-class conditions, economic analysis, Victorian progress) are loosely connected, lacking explicit thematic bridges.
